OK for a first release, but not as polished as expected. Game is laggy in places, load times are quite long. I tried this first on my Nexus 7 (2012) not very playable. Installed on an old Acer Iconia A500 and also a Galaxy Note 10.1. Much easier to play on the bigger screened device. Graphics look nice until you zoom in to a level you need to build stuff, then the cracks start to appear. It looks like an old isometric Commodore 64 game, badly pixellated which makes it difficult to play. The building controls are straight out of Locomotion, love them or hate them. Even the original Transport Tycoon music has been rejigged through a better set of MIDI instruments - doesn't sound quite right now.   I've seen a bunch of graphical glitches where bridge sections flash when vehicles are near them. You can't zoom out enough either to say be able to view two nearby towns in order to plan a route. It's a good start but seems to have been rushed out of the door. Hopefully 31X and Chris Sawyer will carry on working on it and fix these problems

Hopefully these small issues can be addressed in future updates.

So far, seems an excellent reproduction of Locomotion/Transport Tycoon on android, however, the gameplay, including actual game processes as well as scrolling around the map, are very laggy on my 2013 Nexus 7. Once that gets fixed, I'm looking forward to spending long hours playing this game!
